Detailed Description

The section has a list of all internal API which are not exposed to the external applications.

Function Documentation

static void CBUFF_addCQLLEntry ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
CBUFF_LinkListParams *  ptrLLParams 
)
static

Description
The function is used to program the linked list entry for the chirp quality.

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the CBUFF session
[in]ptrLLParamsPointer to the initialized linked list entry which is used to program the linked list.
Return values
Notapplicable
static void CBUFF_addLinkedList ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
CBUFF_LLType  type,
CBUFF_LinkListParams *  ptrLLParams 
)
static

Description
The function is used to add an entry to the CBUFF Linked List

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the CBUFF session
[in]typeLinked List Type which is being added
[in]ptrLLParamsPointer to the Linked List parameters
Return values
Notapplicable
static void CBUFF_addUserBufferLLEntry ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
CBUFF_LinkListParams *  ptrLLParams 
)
static

Description
The function is used to program the linked list entry for the user buffers. This is treated a bit differently because user buffers could be optional from at least 1 to CBUFF_MAX_USER_BUFFER.

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the CBUFF session
[in]ptrLLParamsPointer to the initialized linked list entry which is used to program the linked list.
Return values
Notapplicable

static

Description
The function is used to allocate a session block

Parameters
[in]ptrDriverMCBPointer to the driver MCB
Return values
Success- Allocated session handle
Error- NULL

static void CBUFF_clearStatus ( DSSCBUFFRegs *  ptrCBUFFReg,
uint8_t  isFrameDone,
uint8_t  isChirpDone 
)
static

Description
The function is used to clear the CBUFF status.

Parameters
[in]ptrCBUFFRegPointer to the CBUFF Register space
[in]isFrameDoneSet to 1 to clear the Frame Done Status
[out]isChirpDoneSet to 1 to clear the Chirp Done Status
Return values
Notapplicable

int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to close the CSI Interface for the specific session

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the session
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
void CBUFF_closeEDMA ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession)

Description
The function is used to close the EDMA3 channels which have been configured This is invoked once the CBUFF module is closed

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the CBUFF Session
Return values
Notapplicable

static int32_t CBUFF_configCQEDMA ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession)
static

Description
The function is used to program the EDMA transfers for the chirp quality.

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the CBUFF session
Return values
Success- 0
Error- Error code
int32_t CBUFF_configEDMA ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
uint32_t  srcAddress,
uint32_t  transferSize,
bool  isLast 
)

Description
The function is used to configure the EDMA3 Transfer from the specified source address to the CBUFF FIFO.

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the Session
[in]srcAddressSource Address where the data to be transfered is located
[in]transferSizeSize of the data to be transferred to the FIFO
[in]isLastFlag which if set indicates this is the last transaction
Return values
Success- 0
Error- < 0 [Error code: EDMA/CBUFF Error]
static int32_t CBUFF_configUserBufferEDMA ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession)
static

Description
The function is used to program the EDMA transfers for the user buffers. This is treated a bit differently because user buffers could be optional from at least 1 to CBUFF_MAX_USER_BUFFER.

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the CBUFF session
Return values
Success- 0
Error- Error code

static void CBUFF_deregisterFrameDone ( CBUFF_DriverMCB *  ptrDriverMCB)
static

Description
The function is used to deregister the frame done interrupts. If there are no active sessions which require this functionality then we can deregister this interrupt and not take a performance hit for these interrupts.

Parameters
[in]ptrDriverMCBPointer to the driver MCB
Return values
Notapplicable

[out]isChirpDoneSet to 1 to indicate that the chirp has been done

static void CBUFF_registerFrameDone ( CBUFF_DriverMCB *  ptrDriverMCB)
static

Description
The function is used to register the frame done interrupts. If applications are executing only one session we dont want to overwhelm the processor with frame done interrupts. Frame done interrupts should only be used if there are multiple sessions which are getting activated and the application has registered for callback functions.

Parameters
[in]ptrDriverMCBPointer to the driver MCB
Return values
Notapplicable

static void CBUFF_setChirpAvailableSWTrigger ( DSSCBUFFRegs *  ptrCBUFFReg,
uint32_t  enableSW 
)
static

Description

Parameters

[in]enableSWSet to 1 to enable the triggering be done by the SW else set to 0

Notapplicable

int32_t CBUFF_setup_USER ( CBUFF_DriverMCB *  ptrDriverMCB,
CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to setup the data transfers to handle the following use case:-

  • User Buffer For User data we ignore the Interleaved/Non-interleaved
Parameters
[in]ptrDriverMCBPointer to the CBUFF Driver MCB
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the session
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
static int32_t CBUFF_setupEDMAShadowLink ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
uint8_t  chId,
uint16_t  linkChId,
EDMA_paramSetConfig_t *  config,
EDMA_transferCompletionCallbackFxn_t  transferCompletionCallbackFxn 
)
static

Description
The function is used to setup the EDMA channel with the specified configuration

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the session
[in]chIdEDMA Channel Identifier
[in]linkChIdEDMA Channel Identifer to be linked
[in]configEDMA Parameter set configuration
[in]transferCompletionCallbackFxnOption Transfer completion callback function to be invoked once the transfer is complete.
Return values
Success- EDMA No Error (EDMA_NO_ERR)
Error- EDMA Error code
static int32_t CBUFF_setupHeader ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
CBUFF_LinkListParams *  ptrLinkListParams,
int32_t *  errCode 
)
static

Description
The function is used to setup and program the optional header. The function will create the Linked List Entry and will also setup the EDMA channel for the header if one is to be configured

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the CBUFF session
[in]ptrLinkListParamsPointer to the Linked List Params
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0

void CBUFF_setVC ( DSSCBUFFRegs *  ptrCBUFFReg,
uint8_t  vc,
uint8_t  vcStart,
uint8_t  vcEnd 
)

Description
The function is used to configure the VSYNC parameters for a specific virtual channel.

Parameters
[in]ptrCBUFFRegPointer to the CBUFF Register space
[in]vcVirtual channel [Valid from 0 to 3]
[in]vcStartFlag to enable/disable the VSYNC Start
[in]vcEndFlag to enable/disable the VSYNC End
Return values
Notapplicable
int32_t CBUFF_shutdownTransfer ( CBUFF_Session *  ptrSession,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
The function is used to shutdown the data transfer which have been configured. This will involve the cleaning up on the Shadow Linked List and EDMA channels.

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionPointer to the session
[out]errCodeError code populated by the API
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
static void CBUFF_triggerChirpAvailable ( DSSCBUFFRegs *  ptrCBUFFReg)
static

Description
The function is used to trigger the chirp available. This function should only be invoked if the software has assumed the responsibility for triggering the chirp available

Parameters
[in]ptrCBUFFRegPointer to the CBUFF Register space
Return values
Notapplicable

static

Return values
Notapplicable
static int32_t CBUFF_validateBufferCfg ( CBUFF_BufferCfg *  ptrUserBuffer,
int32_t *  errCode 
)
static

Description
This is the function which is used to validate the buffers configuration. User buffers passed by the applications for either the header OR data buffers need to be placed into the EDMA address space.

Parameters
[in]ptrUserBufferPointer to the user buffer which needs to be validated
[out]errCodeError code populated on the error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
